image.altText: Two men in suits smile and laugh, one is holding a model Rex Airlines plane.

props.synopsis: Rex Airlines' bosses are no longer on speaking terms, but they exclusively told Four Corners the inside story of their failed bid to take on Qantas and Virgin and just who's to blame.

title.children: For the first time since its collapse, Rex bosses share the inside story of how it all went wrong

image.altText: A man wearing a black t shirt inside a cafe.

props.synopsis: Businesses along regional shopping strips need to "stick to their brand" and promote "the uniqueness" of their locations to attract customers during tough times. advocate says.

title.children: Main streets are the economic centre of regional towns, but rising costs are starting to bite business

image.altText: Treasure Boxes volunteers  2024-06-25 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Thousands of pregnant women in Australia are going hungry with many of those too scared to ask for help, according to new research.

title.children: One in ten expecting mothers are going hungry, survey finds

image.altText: A woman with short hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Retirement villages are home to more than 250,000 older Australians, but some residents complain of exorbitant fees, oppressive contracts and a sense of feeling trapped.

title.children: 'An absolute minefield': How these villages became a trap for retirees

image.altText: Qantas plane on the runway at Brisbane airport

props.synopsis: Engineers at Brisbane, Sydney, Canberra, Melbourne, Adelaide, and Perth airports began walking off the job for two hours from 7am as part of the industrial action pushing for a major pay increase.

title.children: Qantas engineers warn of travel delays as they walk off the job across the country

image.altText: three pages of legislation

props.synopsis: Current abortion legislation has been in effect for little more than two years, but a conservative MP argues it's time for more changes. And it comes despite concerns within his own party about his plan, Rory McClaren writes.

title.children: Abortion laws are once again being debated in SA, but some are wondering why

image.altText: Courtney Hodder and Tahlia Hickie celebrate an AFLW goal against Adelaide Crows.

props.synopsis: Brisbane Lions star Taylor Smith kicks the match-winning goal to defeat the Adelaide Crows by two points, while premiership favourite North Melbourne overcomes atrocious conditions to extend its unbeaten start to the season.

title.children: Lions kick last-gasp goal in AFLW win over Crows as Kangaroos get past Tigers

image.altText: An elderly man with grey trousers and blue shirt stands at the door of a red road train truck

props.synopsis: For 85 years, Howard Dicker has been in the driver's seat of the big rigs, connecting his bush community to the big smoke and beyond.

title.children: Pioneering trucker clocks up a lifetime of memories on the open road

image.altText: Artist Tom Moore in his studio, surrounded by his colourful glass creations. He is middle-aged with brown hair and glasses

props.synopsis: Artist Tom Moore won the major FUSE Glass Prize earlier this year using an ancient technique to make intricate and remarkable designs with more than a hint of humour.

title.children: The artist making glass animals that are 'impractical, delicate and definitely not dishwasher-safe'

image.altText: Streaks of light from rockets over the night sky of a city.

props.synopsis: Israel's Iron Dome has successfully intercepted thousands of threats from neighbouring militant groups, but if Hezbollah escalates its strikes, the highly lauded air defence system may not "keep up".

title.children: Hezbollah is striking deeper into Israel with more powerful missiles. It may soon be what cracks the Iron Dome

image.altText: A man with a neutral expression loosk at the camera, while holding up a mobile phone with a picture of a man on the screen

props.synopsis: On the streets of Beirut, some Hezbollah supporters are refusing to believe their leader, Hassan Nasrallah, is dead, while others are warning the man likely to replace him is more "hardline".

title.children: 'He is alive, they hid him': Denial, defiance among Hezbollah supporters as leader's body is pulled from rubble

image.altText: Katy Gallagher, sitting with Jim Chalmers, holds the women's economic budget statement

props.synopsis: A drop in spending has delivered a $15.8 billion surplus for the most recent financial year, despite tax revenue also falling in that time. It's a $6.4 billion improvement on what was forecast in May.

title.children: Final budget result delivers $15.8 billion surplus due to lower spending

image.altText: Two women watching a woman sign Auslan in a pub with other people

props.synopsis: The founders say their events give people an opportunity to chat, practise and learn Auslan in a social setting.

title.children: Social group gives deaf people and those who want to learn Auslan safe space to connect

image.altText: Liberal Troy Bell celebrates on election night

props.synopsis: Before a juror even set foot in the courtroom, the fraud trial of South Australian MP Troy Bell was one of the state's longest-running criminal prosecutions without a verdict. This is why it took so long.

title.children: Why it took almost a decade to prosecute a state MP

image.altText: An aerial view of a highway cutting through rugged landscape

props.synopsis: Community leaders are going public with suspicions missing men may have been murdered after falling foul of the drug trade in outback Australia.

title.children: Suspicions are growing in northern towns that a violent drug trade is causing young men to disappear

image.altText: an illustration of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump standing back to back

props.synopsis: In an election likely to turn on a small shift of votes in a small number of states, seemingly small things could end up being of out-sized significance.

title.children: Beyond Harris and Trump, a multitude of small things could change the US election

image.altText: A man speaks to a handheld recorder device

props.synopsis: The US president says an all-out war in the Middle East must be avoided at all costs amid fears the conflict in Lebanon could spin out of control and draw in Iran, and Israel's main ally the United States.

title.children: Israel bombs Houthi targets in Yemen as Biden says broader conflict 'has to be' avoided

image.altText: Michael Theo wears a Hawaiian shirt as he leans half from behind a black curtain, an awkward look on his face

props.synopsis: Michael Theo said he always felt like "a double scoop of dog crap". Now he's a leading man.

title.children: Doctors said Michael Theo might never talk. Now he's a leading man

image.altText: A shopfront with flowers for sale

props.synopsis: Cost of living pressures are being felt right across the world, and Australia is no different. But how do the cost of our groceries actually compare?

title.children: Grocery prices compared between Australia, UK, NZ and Ireland — who comes out on top?

image.altText: Kris Kristofferson playing guitar on stage.

props.synopsis: A family spokesperson said the actor and singer-songwriter died peacefully at his home in Maui, Hawaii, where he was surrounded by family.

title.children: US singer-songwriter Kris Kristofferson dead at 88

image.altText: An older Palestinian man waves, surrounded by other Palestinian men

props.synopsis: Yahya Sinwar is at the top of Israel's most-wanted list. Here's how he rose to power.

title.children: How Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar got his nickname 'the butcher'

image.altText: A man in a bar with a glass of water

props.synopsis: When Sam Goding was in the grips of alcoholism, he says the price of alcohol didn't matter — he'd reach for methylated spirits mixed with soft drink if he had to. He's on the fence about whether plans to remove the NT's alcohol floor price will make a difference.

title.children: Sam would have done anything for a drink. He's on the fence about the NT's alcohol price laws

image.altText: Joe Daniher celebrates a grand final goal against Sydney

props.synopsis: If the 2024 grand final was Joe Daniher's last game at the AFL, he couldn't have scripted a better way to end things. The star forward's future hangs over Brisbane's drought-breaking flag, but won't halt its hopes of going back-to-back.

title.children: Brisbane won't want Joe Daniher to retire, but can still repeat as premiers if the grand final was his perfect farewell

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has opened 0.5 per cent higher, powering to a new record as Chinese stimulus supports the miners, while Qantas says there have been no delays or cancellations reported despite an escalation of industrial action by ground crews this morning. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX up 0.5pc to new record high on China stimulus, Qantas says industrial action has caused no delays

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX 200 hits new record, up 0.5% on opening led by miners
No delays, despite industrial action — Qantas
Qantas passengers face disruptions as industrial action escalates this morning

image.altText: A group of people at a memorial site.

props.synopsis: The Aboriginal Interpreting Western Australia group say they want more engagement with the justice system, while reflecting on admissions of police misconduct during the coronial inquest into Joshua Warneke's death in 2010.

title.children: Interpreters want to provide 'language rights' after man wrongfully convicted of Joshua Warneke's death

image.altText: A man walks on the shore of a muddy, flooded river

props.synopsis: Deadly rain-related floods and landslides are common across South Asia during the monsoon season from June to September. But experts say climate change is increasing their frequency and severity.

title.children: Nepal closes schools as deaths from flooding and landslides reach at least 170

image.altText: An Australian bowler smiles and hugs a wicketkeeper as his teammates celebrate a wicket in an ODI.

props.synopsis: Australia's men's cricket team, inspired by Travis Head, win their rain-hit, one-day international decider to clinch the series 3-2 against England at Bristol.

title.children: Australia beats England — and rain — to win ODI series

image.altText: Large plastic containers covered in bits of broken bricks.

props.synopsis: The UN says most fatalities were caused by a second strike that landed while first responders were arriving at the site and patients trying to evacuate.

title.children: Russia attacks hospital in Ukraine using suicide drones, killing 10

image.altText: John Ashton smiles in front of a Beverly Hills Cop: Axel mural

props.synopsis: Veteran character actor John Ashton, best known for his role as John Taggart in Beverly Hills Cop, has died.

title.children: Beverly Hills Cop actor John Ashton has died, aged 76

image.altText: Fire ants swarming

props.synopsis: The research beaks down the financial and medical strain a complete infestation would have on Queensland households.

title.children: 'Everybody loses': Researchers expect fire ants to kill six, cost $188m if allowed to spread in Queensland

image.altText: A bearded man in a brown hat, grey polo shirt and has his arms crossed looking at the camera in front of a road train sign.

props.synopsis: With all road users in WA under scrutiny, veteran truck driver Michael King says more comprehensive training is needed.

title.children: 'Do a few simple tests' and you can be a truck driver in WA. These people want change

image.altText: A car drives past a pole with a noise detection camera with a forest in the background.

props.synopsis: Noise cameras will be rolled out across two NSW council areas before the end of the year. The technology will target "anti-social behaviour and noisy vehicles", according to a NSW government tender.

title.children: NSW government to launch new noise cameras in the state

image.altText: A hand wiping a screen door with a bright orange microfibre cloth.

props.synopsis: Insect screens get pretty grotty and benefit from a wash every now and again, but it can be an awkward job, so we asked two experts for their tips.

title.children: How — and how often — do you need to clean your fly screens?

image.altText: People walking in a cemetery.

props.synopsis: While all other graves are neatly aligned on either side of a central walkway, Craig McCallum's grave sits at the head of the cemetery in the middle of that walkway.

title.children: This country cemetery sat dormant for 56 years until a loveable larrikin decided to have one last joke
